conclusion: Understand circuit behavior with and without switch S closed.
Terminal voltage includes both electromotive force and internal resistance.
Calculate equivalent resistance of 10Ω and 20Ω resistors in parallel.
Determine total current from the battery using terminal voltage and equivalent resistance.
Use terminal voltage and current to calculate internal resistance.
Rearrange equation to solve for internal resistance.
Determine voltage between points a and b when S is closed.
Calculate current in the circuit with only the 20Ω resistor.
Voltage across voltmeter equals emf of the battery when S is closed.
Assume internal resistance is negligible for external voltage calculation.
Final voltage between points a and b is approximately 6V.
